newsitem.title: USA: GE to pay $5 mln to settle injury suit.
newsitem.headline: GE to pay $5 mln to settle injury suit.

text.p: General Electric Co said on Thursday it agreed to pay $5 million to settle a lawsuit filed by an electrician who was severely burned after a circuit breaker exploded.

In 1995, electrician Juan Vega was burned over 70 percent of his body when a new General Electric circuit breaker exploded after installation of a GE electrical system, Vega's lawyer and General Electric said.
Frank Branson and William Curtis, in conjunction with Michael Parham, represented Juan and Arlene Vega in the suit, attorneys said.
Vega underwent several skin grafting procedures and additional surgeries to try to correct the scarring and disfigurement.
